MetaData.MetaDataItem: Z-Wave Puck dimmer by Q-light is a micro size in wall dimmer. Features: - 0-100% dimming range - 2-180W LED load - Compatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave Plus Controller - There is memorized function at power off - OverLoad protection - Soft start function - SmartStart - Works with various types of switches – on/off, momentary, roller-blind, and etc - This device is a security enable Z-Wave Plus product that is able to use encrypted Z-Wave Plus messages to communicate to other security enable Z-Wave Plus products.

Removing (Exclusion): Allowing to remove the Z-Wave device from existing Z-Wave network.
1. Place the Z-Wave Puck within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller. 2. Identify switch S1/S2 (turns the light on) or the Internal button (located on the device’s housing). 3. Set the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode (see the controller’s manual). 4. Quickly, three times press switch S1 / S2 or Internal button. 5. Wait for the removing process to end.

Resetting the Z-Wave Puck:
1. Quickly, nine times press switch S1 / S2 or Internal button. 2. Wait for the resetting process to end, which is signaled with the LED indicator blinks 20 times.
Device reset status: Turn on the light at maximum brightness.
Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable

Classic Learn Mode:
1. Place the Z-Wave Puck within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller. 2. Identify switch S1/S2 (turns the light on) or the Internal button (located on the device’s housing). 3. Set the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode (see the controller’s manual). 4. Quickly, three times press switch S1 / S2 or Internal button. 5. Wait for the adding process to end. 6. Successful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.

Value.label: Minimum brightness level
Value.Help: Set the desired value from 1 to 98% for the minimum dim level that the dimmer is restricted to, the dimmer will not go lower than the value set here.

Value.label: Maximum brightness level
Value.Help: Set the desired value from 2 to 99% for the maximum dim level that the dimmer is restricted to, the dimmer will not go higher than the value set here.

Value.label: Automatic control - dimming step size
Value.Help: This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the automatic control.

Value.label: Automatic control - time of a dimming step
Value.Help: This parameter defines the time of single dimming step set in parameter 3 during the automatic control.

Value.label: Manual control - dimming step size
Value.Help: This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the manual control.

Value.label: Manual control - time of a dimming step
Value.Help: This parameter defines the time of single dimming step setin parameter 5 during the manual control.

Value.label: Memory function after power failure
Value.Help: Set the desired value from 0 to 1 to turn on/off the memory function.Setting this value to 0 turns off the dimmer's Memory fucntion.Setting this value to 1 truns on the dimmer's Memory function.

Item.label: Device does not save the state before a power failure, it returns to off position
Device restores it's state before power failure

Value.label: Switch type
Value.Help:
Choose between momentary, ON/OFF and roller blind switch.
Available settings: 0 – momentary (Push) switch. 1 – ON/OFF switch. 2– roller blind switch-two switchs operate the device(S1 to brighter, S2 to dim

Item.label: roller blind switch-two switchs operate the device(S1 to brighter, S2 to dim)

Value.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2
Value.Help: Set the desired value from 0 to 1 to turn on/off the memory function.Setting this value to 0 turns off the dimmer's Memory fucntion.Setting this value to 1 truns on the dimmer's Memory function.

Item.label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Value.label: S1 Scene ID set
Value.Help:
When you press S1 five times,the light is dimmed to the brightness set in Scene ID 3 .
S1 Scene ID is set by this configuration.
Note: The actual action of each SCENE ID are set by SCE-NE_ACTUATOR_CONF(0x26) command.

Value.label: S1 Scene ID set
Value.Help:
When you press S1 five times,the light is dimmed to the brightness set in Scene ID 5.
S2 Scene ID is set by this configuration.
Note: The actual action of each SCENE ID are set by SCE-NE_ACTUATOR_CONF(0x26) command.

Value.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)
Value.Help:
This parameter allows to automatically switch off the device after specified time from switching on the light source. It may be useful when the Zerodim Z-Wave is installed in the stairway.
Available settings: 0 - Function disabled. 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s-9.1h)
